methods.autoValueMapping:
Enables or disables automatic value mapping (true by default).

 If auto value mapping is enabled, any column that was not defined [either by excludeColumn or mapColumn] is
 automatically mapped to a JSON field of the same name.

:param autoValueMapping: (boolean) - should automatic value mapping be enabled
:return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) this builder
methods.create:
Create a serializer using columns of source as input.

:param source: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) - The source Table
:return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.KeyOrValueSerializer<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) The resulting serializer
methods.excludeColumn:
Indicates that a column is unmapped, and therefore not included in the output. You may not exclude a column
 that has already been excluded or mapped.

:param column: (java.lang.String) - name of the column in the output table
:return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) this builder
methods.ignoreMissingColumns:
Permit the builder to silently ignore any columns not specified. False by default. If auto value mapping is
 enabled, this has no effect.

:param ignoreMissingColumns: (boolean) - True if the builder should ignore table columns with no specified behavior. false
        if the builder should throw an exception if columns are found with no mapping.
:return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) this builder
methods.mapColumn:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Map a Deephaven column to a specified output field. You may map multiple output fields from a single column.,
 but may only map a given field once.

*Overload 1*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - The name of the Deephaven column to export
  :return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) this builder
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - The name of the Deephaven column to export
  :param field: (java.lang.String) - The name of the field to produce
  :return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) this builder
methods.nestedObjectDelimiter:
The delimiter used to generate nested output objects from column names.

:param nestedObjectDelimiter: (java.lang.String) - the delimiter string/character.
:return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) this builder
methods.outputNulls:
Whether to output null values.

:param outputNulls: (boolean) - to output nulls
:return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) this builder
methods.sourceColumnNames:
Get a list of the source column names that will be used by the serializers returns by KeyOrValueSerializer.Factory.create(Table).

:param tableDefinition: (io.deephaven.db.tables.TableDefinition) - The TableDefinition of a Table that will be subsequently supplied to
        KeyOrValueSerializer.Factory.create(Table)
:return: (java.util.List<java.lang.String>) The list of input column names
methods.timestampFieldName:
Include a timestamp indicating when this data was processed.

:param timestampFieldName: (java.lang.String) - The name of the field to show a timestamp, or null for no timestamp.
:return: (io.deephaven.kafka.publish.JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder<JsonKeyOrValueSerializer.Builder.SERIALIZED_TYPE>) this builder
methods.validateColumns:
Validate that this factory is compatible with tableDefinition.

:param tableDefinition: (io.deephaven.db.tables.TableDefinition) - A TableDefinition specifying all available source columns

text: Create a builder for processing Deephaven table data into string output
